newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- ends 1/4 to 3/8 higher.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- ends 1/4 to 3/8 higher.

text.p: U.S. municipal bonds were up 1/4 to 3/8 in late trading Thursday, reversing early weakness and tracing the Treasury market's late day gains.
"We snapped back smartly," one trader said. "We're up about 1/4 point." The trader attributed the gains to a rebound effect after Wednesday's post-auction selloff.
A market analyst said activity levels were light to moderate, and some modest bid-wanted lists circulated during the day.
Munis followed the direction of the benchmark 30-year Treasury bond Thursday, which was up 14/32 at 96-6/32 to yield 6.93 percent after trading lower in early action.
Late day muni secondary quotes were also showing some improvement after being flat at midday.
Bids on Chicago Board of Education AMBAC 5-3/4s of 2020 were down two basis points to 5.89 percent. Port of Seattle FGIC 5-1/2s of 2022 were also two basis points lower at 5.80 percent.

In debt futures, June municipal contracts reversed early losses to finish up 15/32 at 115-9/32. June T-bonds ended up 16/32 at 109-26/32. The MOB spread narrowed to 175 ticks from 176 ticks at the close Wednesday.

Merrill Lynch & Co. priced and repriced the day's largest new issue, a $111 million Massachusetts Port Authority deal. At the repricing, the top yield was 6.03 percent in 2039. To see the scale, double click on nN08245516.

PaineWebber Inc. won the day's largest competitive deal, a $54 million Minnesota Housing Finance Agency deal which the firm reoffered to yield 5.35 percent in 2009. The 2017 term bonds were not formally reoffered.
